dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So Bezos, uh, just sold a bunch of Amazon stock because he's getting out of the tech game entirely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Bezos, uh, just sold a bunch of Amazon stock because he's getting out of the tech game entirely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is unclear why Bezos is selling these shares.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: What? No! That's completely wrong. He's just diversifying, like.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What? No! That's completely wrong. He's just diversifying, like.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is unclear why Bezos is selling these shares.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Diversifying? Come on. He's bailing after that congressional hearing, avoiding all the antitrust heat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Diversifying? Come on. He's bailing after that congressional hearing, avoiding all the antitrust heat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This latest sell-off comes less than a week after Bezos testified before Congress, via Zoom, as part of an antitrust investigation... It is unclear why Bezos is selling these shares.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: That's, um, an unfair assumption. He's been selling stock for Blue Origin for years!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's, um, an unfair assumption. He's been selling stock for Blue Origin for years!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2017, the Amazon founder stated at a space conference he would be selling $1 billion worth of shares every year to fund Blue Origin, his space exploration company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but $2.4 billion after taxes? This isn't just Blue Origin pocket change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but two point four dollars billion after taxes? This isn't just Blue Origin pocket change.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After taxes, the billionaire will take home an estimated $2.4 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: It's part of the plan! And he's got the Day One Fund, the Earth Fund. Billions going to charity!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's part of the plan! And he's got the Day One Fund, the Earth Fund. Billions going to charity!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He made a $2 billion pledge in September 2018 for the Bezos Day One Fund... He also made a $10 billion pledge in February to the Bezos Earth Fund, dedicated to climate change

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Charity? He's investing in AI startups and green energy projects. He's just finding new ways to make money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Charity? He's investing in A I startups and green energy projects. He's just finding new ways to make money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article does not mention investments in AI startups or green energy projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: The Earth Fund is ten billion dollars to fight climate change! That's not, like, a new way to get rich.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Earth Fund is ten billion dollars to fight climate change! That's not, like, a new way to get rich.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also made a $10 billion pledge in February to the Bezos Earth Fund, dedicated to climate change; no updates have been given since its founding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It's a tax write-off, a PR move. While he's still worth $188 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a tax write-off, a P R move. While he's still worth one hundred eighty eight dollars billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes estimates his net worth at $188.2 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: He's actually distributed almost $250 million already to homeless nonprofits. That's real impact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's actually distributed almost two hundred fifty dollars million already to homeless nonprofits. That's real impact.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since the announcement, Bezos has given away nearly $200 million to homeless-focused nonprofits.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: That's a drop in the bucket compared to his net worth, or what he just pulled from Amazon. But it's progress!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a drop in the bucket compared to his net worth, or what he just pulled from Amazon. But it's progress!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: He's committing to these things. Zuckerberg and Cook also went before Congress, um, did they pledge billions?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's committing to these things. Zuckerberg and Cook also went before Congress, um, did they pledge billions?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Apple CEO Tim Cook and Google CEO Sundar Pichai also testified.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It's all smoke and mirrors, a distraction from the monopolistic practices, uh, they're scrutinizing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's all smoke and mirrors, a distraction from the monopolistic practices, uh, they're scrutinizing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's a strategic shift, investing in the future, giving back. You're just being cynical!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's a strategic shift, investing in the future, giving back. You're just being cynical!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: I'm being realistic! He's moving assets, avoiding scrutiny, all while looking like a philanthropist.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I'm being realistic! He's moving assets, avoiding scrutiny, all while looking like a philanthropist.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: He is a philanthropist! He's one of the biggest donors right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He is a philanthropist! He's one of the biggest donors right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article mentions his pledges but does not rank him among other donors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: No, you're just refusing to see it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, you're just refusing to see it.
